author: SteveL-MSFT
body:
<!-- Anything that looks like this is a comment and can't be seen after the Pull Request is created. -->  

## PR Summary

The code had a simple (potentially incorrect) check if path is UNC and other code relied on a pinvoke to a win32 api.  There is an existing utility method to check if a path is UNC using the URI class.  Update all code to use this single utility method.

It seems we have a gap in the tests :-(

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT I still believe that we need tests because we did not catch the problem previously in tests and we can create a regression.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov agree we have a test gap, but it's unclear where the simple verification of seeing if the path started with two backslashes would fail which is why I said "potentially".  The `FileSystem.Tests.ps1` has some UNC specific tests.  This was more of a code cleanup than fixing a known issue so not sure what test to add here.

title: Update code to use single method to check if path is UNC
